body:
Hi @dosisod, thanks for the issue!

This works as expected. `/* eslint-disable camelcase */` disables the camelcase rule in the range that starts from that directive and ends with `/* eslint-enable camelcase */`, or `/* eslint-enable */`, or end of file, whichever comes first.

`eslint-enable` directives are not paired with previous `eslint-disable` directives. `/* eslint-enable */` (without rules specified) simply re-enables all rules, starting from that point in the code.

If you want to disable the camelcase rule for the entire file, you can also use a [rule configuration comment](https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/configuring/rules#using-configuration-comments) `/* eslint camelcase: "off" */`

> If so, there are no docs (that I could find) that explain this feature.

Documentation for `eslint-disable` and `eslint-enable` directives is here: https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/configuring/rules#using-configuration-comments-1

I agree that this behavior should be explained more precisely. I'm marking this issue as accepted to improve the documentation.
@dosisod are you willing to send a PR to improve our docs for this case?
Yes @snitin315, I would be willing to do that! I'll go ahead and write it up tomorrow.

issue.title: docs: Add clarification about `eslint-enable`

issue.body:
Closes https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/15662

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

[x] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Add clarification to how the `eslint-enable` rule works, and what to do if you want to guarantee a rule is always ignored.


<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->
